nodes.bodyText: You shouldn't need to whitelist Camel configuration classes with Camel 3.5. The issues behind it should be fixed now.
Thanks for the suggestion. I'll look into option of fixing problem in its root in camel.
I should have also added that in Camel 3.5, you no longer have to register the various  EndpointConfiguration classes for reflection. So that part can be removed too.

I didn't probably understood your previous comment correctly. To be sure:

I have to fix reason of failed reflection for camel classes
I can remove registration for reflection for camel, right?

Urgh! Sorry for the confusion. I forgot I have not committed the crucial part that removes the policy extension yet.
Let me do on the camel-master branch ASAP and your changes should work ok afterwards. I'll ping you when it's done.
@JiriOndrusek if you rebase on the latest work from camel-master, it should work for you now.
Camel master has moved on to 1.66 so we should align with that.
yes, I agree. I'll change version of bouncycastle.
